metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3196 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
ssl/s3_clnt.c in OpenSSL 1.0.0 before 1.0.0t, 1.0.1 before 1.0.1p, and1.0.2 before 1.0.2d, when used for a multi-threaded client, writes the PSKidentity hint to an incorrect data structure, which allows remote serversto cause a denial of service (race condition and double free) via a craftedServerKeyExchange message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3196` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.16
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.16').
